meanings.definition: To make more lively or energetic.
meanings.sent1: After a quick nap, the music pepped him up for the dance party.
meanings.sent2: She pepped up the boring presentation with some colorful visuals.
meanings.sent3: The energetic puppy pepped up the sleepy cat, making her chase him around the house.
meanings.sent4: The sunshine pepped up the gloomy day, bringing smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent5: The coach's motivational speech really pepped up the team before the big game.

meanings.definition: To add zest or vigor to.
meanings.sent1: The chef pepped up the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.
meanings.sent2: A cup of coffee always pepped him up in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly antics pepped up the children at the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist really pepped up the movie, keeping the audience engaged.
meanings.sent5: A dash of hot sauce can really pepped up the flavor of a bland meal.
